data.sentence: The word مِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهَ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
The word أَوْ comes from the root ا و and is associated with the meanings: or
The word فَلَا comes from the root ل ا and is associated with the meanings:
The word فَمَنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness
data.sentence: The word بَيْنَهُمْ comes from the root ب ي ن and is associated with the meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness

data.meanings: Rahima - He favored, benefited, pardoned, or forgave him. To love, have tenderness, mercy, pity, forgiveness, have all that is required for exercising beneficence.. Tarhamu - He had mercy, pity, or compassion on him; he pitied or compassionated him much.. Arham - Wombs (singular) womb, i.e. place of origin. The receptacle of the young in the belly.. Ruhmun - Relationship, i.e. nearness of kin, connection by birth; relationship connecting with an ancestor. A connection or tie of relationship.. Rahman - it is active participle noun in the measure of fa'lan which conveys the idea of fullness and extensiveness.. Rahim - it is in the measure of fa'il which denotes the idea of constant repetition and giving.
data.sentence: The word رَحِيمٌ comes from the root ر ح م and is associated with the meanings: Rahima - He favored, benefited, pardoned, or forgave him. To love, have tenderness, mercy, pity, forgiveness, have all that is required for exercising beneficence.. Tarhamu - He had mercy, pity, or compassion on him; he pitied or compassionated him much.. Arham - Wombs (singular) womb, i.e. place of origin. The receptacle of the young in the belly.. Ruhmun - Relationship, i.e. nearness of kin, connection by birth; relationship connecting with an ancestor. A connection or tie of relationship.. Rahman - it is active participle noun in the measure of fa'lan which conveys the idea of fullness and extensiveness.. Rahim - it is in the measure of fa'il which denotes the idea of constant repetition and giving.

data.meanings: to commit a crime/sin or lie. ithm - sin, crime, guilt, iniquity, lie, anything that hinders from good deeds, harmful, anything which renders a person deserving of punishment, anything that pricks the mind as something evil, unlawful. athaam - punishment of wickedness, the requital. aathim - evil doer, one who sins. athiim - wicked person. taa'thiim - accusation of crime.
data.sentence: The word إِثْمَ comes from the root ا ث م and is associated with the meanings: to commit a crime/sin or lie. ithm - sin, crime, guilt, iniquity, lie, anything that hinders from good deeds, harmful, anything which renders a person deserving of punishment, anything that pricks the mind as something evil, unlawful. athaam - punishment of wickedness, the requital. aathim - evil doer, one who sins. athiim - wicked person. taa'thiim - accusation of crime.

data.meanings: protect, cover over, shield, forgive, pardon.
data.sentence: The word غَفُورٌ comes from the root غ ف ر and is associated with the meanings: protect, cover over, shield, forgive, pardon.

data.meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.
data.sentence: The word خَافَ comes from the root خ و ف and is associated with the meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.

data.meanings: to join to, be joined, be contiguous, to have dense vegetation. wassa - to bequeath, recommend, order, command with wise counsel and sermon, charge, exhort, enjoin, make a will.
data.sentence: The word مُوصٍ comes from the root و ص ي and is associated with the meanings: to join to, be joined, be contiguous, to have dense vegetation. wassa - to bequeath, recommend, order, command with wise counsel and sermon, charge, exhort, enjoin, make a will.

data.meanings: To incline or decline (in speech and all affairs), decline or deviate from the right course, act wrongfully/unjustly/tyrannically, deviate from that which is right, act unjustly or wrongfully in judgement, incline to a wrong course or decline from the right course, carry oneself in a proud and self-conceited manner.
data.sentence: The word جَنَفًا comes from the root ج ن ف and is associated with the meanings: To incline or decline (in speech and all affairs), decline or deviate from the right course, act wrongfully/unjustly/tyrannically, deviate from that which is right, act unjustly or wrongfully in judgement, incline to a wrong course or decline from the right course, carry oneself in a proud and self-conceited manner.

data.meanings: to commit a crime/sin or lie. ithm - sin, crime, guilt, iniquity, lie, anything that hinders from good deeds, harmful, anything which renders a person deserving of punishment, anything that pricks the mind as something evil, unlawful. athaam - punishment of wickedness, the requital. aathim - evil doer, one who sins. athiim - wicked person. taa'thiim - accusation of crime.
data.sentence: The word إِثْمًا comes from the root ا ث م and is associated with the meanings: to commit a crime/sin or lie. ithm - sin, crime, guilt, iniquity, lie, anything that hinders from good deeds, harmful, anything which renders a person deserving of punishment, anything that pricks the mind as something evil, unlawful. athaam - punishment of wickedness, the requital. aathim - evil doer, one who sins. athiim - wicked person. taa'thiim - accusation of crime.

data.meanings: to be right/good/honest/upright/sound/righteous, suit, fit. aslaha - to set a thing aright, reform, do good. saalihaat - good works, fit and suiting deeds. aslaha (vb. 4) - to make whole sound, set things right, effect an agreement between, render fit. islaah - uprightness, reconciliation, amendment, reformation. muslihun - reformer, one who is upright, righteous, a person of integrity, peacemaker, suitable.saalih - name of a prophet sent to the tribe of Thamuud.
data.sentence: The word فَأَصْلَحَ comes from the root ص ل ح and is associated with the meanings: to be right/good/honest/upright/sound/righteous, suit, fit. aslaha - to set a thing aright, reform, do good. saalihaat - good works, fit and suiting deeds. aslaha (vb. 4) - to make whole sound, set things right, effect an agreement between, render fit. islaah - uprightness, reconciliation, amendment, reformation. muslihun - reformer, one who is upright, righteous, a person of integrity, peacemaker, suitable.saalih - name of a prophet sent to the tribe of Thamuud.
